edu.rit.numeric

Class BracketMonotonic

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.Bracket
      • edu.rit.numeric.BracketMonotonic

  • public class BracketMonotonic
extends Bracket
    Class BracketMonotonic provides an object that finds a bracketing interval for a root of a monotonic Function. Given a real-valued function of a real-valued variable f(x), an instance of class BracketMonotonic finds values x1 and x2 such that f(x1) and f(x2) have opposite signs, as follows: From the initial bracketing interval, the length of the interval is increased in a multiplicative fashion by increasing x2 until the interval brackets a root.

    • Method Detail

      • bracket

        public void bracket(Function func)
        Find a bracketing interval for the given function. When called, fields x1 and x2 are the initial bracketing interval endpoints. Upon return, fields x1 and x2 have been adjusted to bracket a root; fields f_x1 and f_x2 contain the function values at x1 and x2; and f_x1 and f_x2 have opposite signs.
        Specified by:
        bracket in class Bracket
        Parameters:
        func - Function.
        Throws:
        TooManyIterationsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if too many iterations have occurred without finding a bracketing interval.
